section: The business name of the Venture will be BM&V2GO, however the partnership name will be Vaccines2Go.
explanation: This section creates ambiguity and potential contradiction. While BM&V2GO is designated as the business name of the Venture, the contract also specifies Vaccines2Go as the partnership name. It's unclear if these are intended to be interchangeable or if they represent distinct legal entities or aspects of the Venture. This misalignment can cause confusion regarding branding, legal filings, and liability.

section:
Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"):
Member Contribution Description Agreed Value
BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500.00 USD
JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The agreed value for JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's contribution appears excessively high ($3,500,000.00 USD) compared to BorrowMoney.com, inc's contribution ($3,500.00 USD). This discrepancy raises concerns about whether the valuation accurately reflects the actual value of JVLS, LLC's contribution or if there's a typo/error. The description also includes a combination of a fixed amount and a percentage of gross revenue, making it complex and potentially difficult to calculate the exact contribution. This inconsistency can cause disputes during profit distribution or in case of dissolution.

section: Management Voting 42. Any management vote required will be determined such that each Manager receives one vote carrying equal weight, unless otherwise decided by BorrowMoney.com inc.
explanation: This creates a potential contradiction and imbalance of power. The first part of the sentence clearly states that each manager gets one vote, carrying equal weight. However, the clause 'unless otherwise decided by BorrowMoney.com inc' gives BorrowMoney.com inc the unilateral power to alter the voting weight, potentially overriding the equal vote principle. This undermines the principle of shared control and could lead to disputes regarding management decisions.
